En esta oportunidad la señora Hermelinda requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más.

La socia Hermelinda agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Hermelinda is 35 years old, single and has no children.  She was born in the province of Apurcima but now lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her business is making "Oropesa" bread, which she has done since an early age.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who was invited to belong to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" communal bank, part of the Asociacion Arariwa.  At this time Hermelinda needs a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter and other things.  Hermelinda is grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter and other things.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, a 48-year-old mother of four, lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte: Philippines where she has been operating a shoe repair shop to earn a living for 10 years now, each month earning PHP 3,600.

In 2008, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase shoe materials such as thread, a cutter, etc. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase shoe materials such as thread, a cutter, etc.

loans.name: Emmadelyn

texts.en:
For over seven years in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Emmadelyn, a 31-year-old married mother of two, has made a living through charcoal sales. She earns 7,280 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emmadelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for the labor costs involved in charcoal-making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs involved in charcoal-making.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, from Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte, is 44 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Nimfa has been running a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community for seven years now, earning 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nimfa joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a co-founder of the Manuela Ramos Movement, a feminist organization whose goal is to attain conditions of equality amongst women and men, as well as a plural and democratic society where human rights and social justice prevail. She would like to invest in quality yarns for the group's alpaca wool and alpaca blend fashion accessories. Alicia has been working with NOVICA since 2008. This is the story of the group she helped found: The Manuela Ramos Movement came to life in Peru in 1978. The group contributes to the development and strengthening of women's skills and abilities with a view to promoting and exercising their civil and human rights. The group uses ancestral techniques in the creation of a broad range of hand-knitted and crocheted alpaca accessories. Says Alicia, "Many thanks for funding this microcredit. We'd like to create a new collection of designs that you'll feel proud to wear, and we want to feel satisfied with the results. May God bless you!" Use the link below to view Alicia and the Movement's works on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6785

loans.use: to purchase yarn in bulk for use in the knitting of alpaca accessories

loans.name: Ermetenia

texts.en:
Ermetania, a 55-year-old married mother of six, lives in the Philippines where she is a farmer managing a gardening business to earn a living. In business for 22 years, every month she earns about 15,000 PHP.

In 2010, Ermetania joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation; she is now requesting a loan of 29,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Vera Angiely

texts.en:
Vera Angiely, a single mother of one child, is 22 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. Vera Angiely owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. In business for five years, she earns about 16,000 PHP each month.

In 2011, Vera Angiely joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town, Southern area in Bo. She is divorced with one child, age 18 years old. Her child is currently attending school. She began this because she does not want to be foolish by men and she want to take care of her family. Fatmata runs a foodstuff business. She sells palm oil, fish and gari [cassava flakes]. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at her business 10 hours a day and 7 day per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge for her business is transportation – it is very difficult to catch from the place she goes to buy her stock. Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, bag pepper and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she plans to be a supplier. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, bag pepper and gari to sell.

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Basilia se dedica a esta actividad de venta de artesanía  desde hace 25 años. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de chinandega. es madre de cinco hijos, el mayor tiene 22 años y el menor tiene ocho años, tres de ellos están en edad escolar, por lo cual ella trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde ya que se esfuerza por brindarle educación y estudios a sus hijos.

su negocio lo inicio su esposo que actualmente habita y es padre de sus cinco hijos. ella se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas. este negocio ella lo inicio con esfuerzo propio viendo como hacían las piñatas intento hacer una y no le quedo muy bien, pero no se dio por vencida lucho hasta dejar una buena. ella nunca fue a una escuela a aprender como hacer piñata ya que su núcleo familiar es grande y no tenia lugar.  todos sus hijos han seguido el ejemplo de la señora Basilia, elaboran en el transcurso de una semana dos docenas de piñatas. estas piñatas se hacen  con una tinaja, la forran con periódico, le hacen las manos, las piernas, la cabeza. la ponen a secar de tres a cuatro días para luego vestirla según la caricatura. estas piñatas son para celebraciones de cumpleaños de niños. las rellenan con muchos caramelos, y en el momento de quebrarla le dan con un palo. los ojos de los niños  están cubiertos con un pañuelo para hacer divertida la fiesta de cumpleaños hasta quebrarla y que caigan todos los caramelos y los demás invitados se tiren al suelo a quien agarre mas caramelos. en su negocio vende también hamacas.  en la foto sale con una hamaca a la par, colchones,artesanías,piñatas elaboradas por ella misma y las dos pequeñas por sus hijos.

también la señora Ana cuenta con un taller de carpintería el cual lo trabaja su esposo, que con mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante. elaboran lo que es batellas, lo cuales son lavanderos de madera pequeños, mesas, roperos, chineros, molenillos, bancos. ambos negocios lo trabajan en conjunto con todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Basilia has worked selling handicrafts for 25 years.  Her business is located in one of the markets in Chinandega.  She is the mother of five children: the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 8.  Three of them are in school, so she works from Monday to Sunday from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon in order to raise and educate them.

Her business was started by her husband who is still living and who is the father of her five chilren.  She works making pinatas.  She started this activity on her own, after having watched how pinatas were made and trying to make one, but it did not turn out well.  However, she did not give up, and kept trying until she made a good one. She never went to school to learn how to make a pinata because her family was large and there was no opportunity.  All of her children have followed her example, and make dozens of pinatas every week.  These pinatas are made with a large earthen jar, which is covered with newspapers using the hands, legs and head. They are left to dry for three or four days before being dressed as cartoon characters.  These pinatas are for children's birthday celebrations.  They are filled with many candies, and when it is time to break them the children are given a stick.  The children's eyes are covered with a handkerchief to make the party fun, until the pinatas are broken and all the candy falls out, and the guests throw themselves to the ground to see who can grab the candies.  In her business she also sells hammocks.  In the photo she is shown with a hammock, mattresses, handicrafts, and pinatas that she made, the two smallest of which were made by her children.  

Ana also has a carpentry shop where her husband works, which he has made successful with great effort.  He makes "batellas", which are small wooden washtubs,  tables, wardrobes, china cabinets, handmills, and benches. They work together in both businesses with all of their children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as : hammocks, racks, mattresses, and materials to make pinatas.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 51-year-old married woman with 4 children living in Tabuan, Tukuran. Her husband is a farmer. In order to earn income for the family, she started a business buying and selling vegetables 6 years ago. 

Tessie joined GDMPC in 2009. She usually gets 4,000 PHP per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Tessie will be able to buy more vegetables to sell. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
El señor Oswaldo tiene 38 años de edad, él tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, él se dedica a la elaboración de “pan oropesa” desde muy temprano en una panadería pero el local es alquilado, él es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que le invitaron a participar del Banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

En esta oportunidad el señor Oswaldo requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar mas “Pan Oropesa” por lo tanto va comprar azúcar, harina, manteca y otras cosas más.        

El señor Oswaldo agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 38 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has two children. He was born in and lives in the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. 

He has been making "Orpesa" bread at a bakery from a young age, but the shop is rented. He is an enterprising and hard-working man, who has been invited to participate in the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. 

On this occasion, Oswaldo needs the loan to buy ingredients for making more Orpesa bread, so he is going to buy sugar, flour, lard, and other things.

Oswaldo is grateful for the loan and promises to pay his installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, lard, and other things.

loans.name: Guadalupe Fanny

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 44 años, es madre de 2 hijos a quienes ama muchísimo, pero son su motor para vivir y la razón para salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo para darles una vida digna y sobre todo para que sean personas de bien. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. Como buena peruana a _Guadalupe le gusta mucho los platillos típicos de nuestro país, pero su plato favorito es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Fanny trabaja en su negocio de compra y venta de productos reciclados y chatarra, también tiene una mototaxi, la cual alquila y con ello tiene unos ingresos extra para los gastos de su hogar, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día  y puede atender hasta 35 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta trabajar.

Guadalupe está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su mototaxi y también podrá comprar más mercadería para vender a sus clientes, de esta manera tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y podrá seguir alquilándolo, asimismo podrá tener más mercadería para ofrecer y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 44 years old. She is the mother of 2 children who she loves a lot, and are the driving force in her live. The reason to get ahead with much force is to give them a decent life and above all, so that they are good people. Her home is located in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized for having a very warm and friendly climate. Also in this city, agriculture is developed. Especially grown are cotton, grapes, asparagus, among others. One is also able to find tourist attractions, like the beautiful "Laguna e Huacachina", located amid impressive dunes, and in which one can practice sports like sand-boarding. Like a good Peruvian, Guadalupe likes the typical plates of the country a lot, but her favorite plate is the delicious "rice with chicken". Because of few economic resources, she only completed secondary education, but she would have liked to have studied a university degree. 

Day by day, Fanny works in her business of the purchase and sale of recycled products and scraps. She also has a mototaxi, which she rents and with it has some extra income for household expenses. She works around 8 hours a day, and serves up to 35 customers daily. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is very responsible and above all, because she likes to work. 

Guadalupe is very thankful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help that they have provided her, she has been able to to perform general maintenance on her mototaxi and also will be able to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers. In this way, she will have a vehicle in good shape and will be able to continue renting it. She will also be able to have more merchandise to offer and will be able to improve her profits, which will allow her to continue working to be able to make her big dream more real: "To finish the construction of her house with good materials and to give her children a profession".

loans.use: to maintain her mototaxi and to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La señora Zenovia tiene 40 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, ella después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la elaboración de pan oropesa pero es ayudante por el momento, ella también se dedica a la venta de especería, ella compra sus especerias en la ciudad del Cusco y después distribuye a los vendedores de diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Lima, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa por ser una persona responsable y carismática. En esta oportunidad la señora Zenovia requiere el préstamo para comprar especerías como por ejemplo clavo, comino, canela, pimienta y otros más.   

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Zenovia is 40 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has four children. She was born in, and lives in, the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. After doing her household chores she makes "Oropesa" bread; at the moment she is a helper.

She also sells spices. She buys her spices in the city of Cusco, and later distributes them to the merchants in various markets in the city of Lima. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who has been invited to participate in the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank in Asociación Arariwa. This is because she is a responsible and charismatic person.  

On this occasion Zenovia needs the loan to buy spices such as for example cloves, cumin, cinnamon, pepper and others.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy spices such as cloves, cumin, cinnamon, pepper and others.

loans.name: Olga Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Paulina tiene 45 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, ella después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la elaboración de pan oropesa, ella desde que era muy niña se dedica a la elaboración de pan  y le va muy bien, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.


En esta oportunidad la señora Olga Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para seguir preparando el rico pan de oropesa entonces va comprar sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina, manteca y otras cosas más.
     
La socia Olga Paulina agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Olga Paulina is 45 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She was born in, and lives in, the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. After doing her household chores she makes "Oropesa" bread. She has been making bread since she was a very young girl, and it is going very well. 

She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who has been invited to participate in the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank in Asociación Arariwa. 

On this occasion Olga Paulina needs the loan to buy ingredients so that she can continue preparing the delicious Orpesa bread. 

The borrower Olga Paulina is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, lard and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la hermosa ciudad de Piura pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Desde hace 28 años que vive en la ciudad de Oropesa pues se vino a vivir por motivos de trabajo de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y vende sus productos a sus amigas, vecinas, familiares y otras personas, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

En esta oportunidad la señora Gladys requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza como perfumes, aretes, pulseras, talcos, anillos y otras cosas más.   
  
La socia Gladys agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. She was born in the beautiful city of Piura, and presently lives in the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. She has been living in the town of Oropesa for 28 years, as she came there to live for reasons of her husband's work. 

She sells cosmetics and other products to her friends, neighbors, family members and other people.

She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who has been invited to participate in the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank in Asociación Arariwa. 

On this occasion Gladys needs the loan to buy more beauty products such as perfumes, earrings, bracelets, powders, rings and other items.  

The borrower Gladys is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as perfumes, earrings, bracelets, powders, rings and other items.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La señora Simeona tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica  de la socia es la elaboración de pan  de “oropesa”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Simeona es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

En esta oportunidad la señora Simeona requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. Su sueño de la socia es tener su propio horno pues actualmente alquila un local para elaborar sus panes.  

La socia Simeona agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Simeona is 51 years old, is married, and as a result of this relationship has three children. She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Her business is making bread of "Oropesa". Already, several years have been dedicated to this business and it is going very well. 

Simeona is an enterprising and hardworking woman who was invited to participate in the communal bank "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa", of the Asociación Arariwa. 

This time, Simeona needs the loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, and other things. Her dream is to have her own oven, or actually to rent one locally to make her bread. 

Simeona is thankful for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, and other things.

loans.name: Putu Gede

texts.en: Putu Gede is an artisan and designer who specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver to expand production. Putu Gede has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story: Putu Gede has been passionate about designing since childhood. "I love to create something based on traditional styles and combine them with a modern look. I've come to realize the importance of having a skill, so I've made a point of offering free training in silversmith techniques. My hope is that, by doing so, people in need will be able to earn a decent living and support their family." "Thank you so much for your support with this interest-free microcredit, because it will really help me to continue my business. I just recruited a new silversmith to help us, and we still need capital to buy the material. All of you who have helped and supported me mean a lot to me. My deepest gratitude and love to all of you." Use the link below to view Putu Gede's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6981

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk for his handmade jewelry

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna earns through buying and selling of personal use products/cosmetics sales. She started five years ago. 

Edna is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Edna usually earns PHP 4,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Edna will be able to obtain more cosmetic products, such as lotion and perfumes, to sell because of the money amounting to PHP 5,000 rendered to her. 

She joined GDMPC recently. Someday, she is hoping for much greater revenue for her business expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more cosmetic products, such as lotion and perfumes, to sell.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is married and has three children. She is 31 years old and resides at Sto. Niño,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Jessel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been two years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Recently, Jessel joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Lauriet

texts.es:
La clienta es una mujer joven que vive con sus dos hijos menores de edad,pierde a su compañero por muerte repentina , causada por un infarto ,teniendo que buscar la forma de ser autosuficiente y generar ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
Ella trabaja en la agricultura de hortalizas como chile dulce, pepino, chayotes , malanga y plàtano verde.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su padre en las actividades de siembra y recolecciòn de la cosecha.
Sus productos los vende en la feria del agricultor, los dìas viernes y sàbados, ubicada en Turrialba, cantòn de la provincia de Cartago.
Se le presenta problemas de falta de capital para comprar mayor cantidad de semillas e insumos, que le permitiràn tener una mayor cosecha y asì atender mejor la demanda de su clientela.
Entre sus metas està el poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
The client is a young woman who lives with her two minor children. She lost her partner through sudden death caused by a heart attack, and had to look for a way to be self-sufficient and generate income for supporting her children.

She farms, growing vegetables such as sweet chili peppers, cucumbers, pear squash, and plantains. She has her father's help with the planting and harvesting work. 

She sells her produce at the farmers market held on Thursdays and Saturdays in Turrialba canton, in Cartago province. 

She is experiencing problems due to a lack of working capital for buying seeds and agricultural supplies in greater quantity. Having this would allow her to have a bigger harvest and better serve the demand from her clientele. 

Among her goals is to be able to build her house.

loans.use: To buy sweet chili pepper and cucumber seeds, as well as manure and sprays for the plantings.

loans.name: Rizabel

texts.en:
Rizabel is married, 23 years of age, and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran together with her four children. 

Rizabel is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc. 

She joined GDMPC this year. Rizabel wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en: Mryna is from Pandahan, SND. She is 48 years old. Mryna is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Mryna is running a general store, selling a variety of foods and home use products in the local community. Mryna has been in her business for 10 years and earns 4,800 PHP a month for these activities. Mryna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This year, Mryna joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married and has five children. She is 39 years old and resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Conchita is operating a fish-selling business venture for a living, while her husband does fishing. She has been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 2,200 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. 

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is married with 4 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Mailen, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Karen owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 9,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Karen is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Karen's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Lily is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Lily plants and harvests flowers for sale. Lily has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lily joined GDMPC. Lily is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase flower pots and new varieties of flowers to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase flower pots and new varieties of flowers to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City, Philippines. Alicia is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables like leafy vegetables and squash to earn a living. She's been doing this for 7 years. She earns 5,000 PHP each month in this work. She has requested a loan of 5,900 PHP from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Alicia been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Alicia hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married and a mother of two dependant children. She is 31 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lolita makes and sells furniture to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She earns 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture making. Lolita is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Lorna is married and has two children. Lorna has had a motor transportation service for two years and earns 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Jorelyn

texts.en: Jorelyn is from Macupa Tangub. She is 40 years old. Jorelyn is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Jorelyn plants and harvests bananas for sale. Jorelyn has engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Jorelyn joined GDMPC. Jorelyn is requesting a loan of 12,400 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is married and has 3 children who are 3 and 16 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Dilbar decided to start her own business. She has been busy with her own business more than 5 months. She sews national women's dresses. She is a woman of fashion and sews very beautiful dresses. Her clients are happy with her work. She wants to develop her business but her income is small and she is not able to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics. In this way she will get through using her own assets and her business will continue to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Ermalyn

texts.en:
Ermalyn is single, 22 years old, and resides in Maningcol, Ozamis City. She has had a retail store that sells a variety of different products for four years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2011, Ermalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ermalyn hopes for business progress one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (preserved foods, rice, sugar, noodles and other items)

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en:
To start a pig-raising business, Winangun Sari groups require additional funding and training from MUK. They already have experience of raising pigs previously, performed by their wives. With the training provided, they hope to have more knowledge about raising pigs. The total loan is 18M Rupiah (IDR) and each receives 3M IDR. 

Winangun Sari group is still chaired by I Nengah.  He used the loan to buy five piglets and feed. He plans to keep pigs for fattening. I Nengah and all Winangun Sari group members hope that this new effort will succeed and bring prosperity to their families.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and feed

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 38 years old. He is married to Regina and together they have three children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past five years. 

This is his first loan. He was introduced to us by his friend, who is our client. He will use the loan to add onto his savings and purchase a dairy cow. 

He hopes to to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Los Excelentes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group, Los Excelentes 1, 2 & 3, which is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area outside of the city.

Francisca sells underwear. She and the other members are doing business in their community and nearby ones. She is a hardworking mother with four children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to provide for her family and to help her long-term partner with extra income.

She is receiving her fifth loan from Esperanza Internacional, and she is committed to working harder to improve her business. Francisca would like to save her profits to reinvest in her business. She wants to be a wholesaler and sell to other sellers. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Mugiono

texts.en:
Mugiono, 43 years old, lives in Negara, in western Bali, with his wife and two children, who are in junior high school and kindergarten. His wife is a housewife. Mugiono has worked in his car repair shop for more than 10 years.

Because Mugiono's services satisfy his customers, he has a lot of customers. He is currently repairing a car that needs new parts. For that, he needs additional capital to be able to do his job. This loan will be used to purchase spare parts, oil and other shop equipment. He hopes, with the support of this capital, that he will have even more satisfied customers.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, oil and other shop equipment

loans.name: Dorocas

texts.en:
Dorocas is 45 years old. She is married to John, and together they have five children. She is a farmer and has been in farming for the past 11 years, and the business is great.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase chicks to rear for poultry keeping for additional income.

She hopes to build rental houses from profits she will get from her poultry farming.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to rear for poultry keeping.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda pero tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica  de la socia es la elaboración de pan  de “oropesa”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Alejandra es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Alejandra requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. 

Su sueño de la socia es tener su propio horno pues actualmente alquila un local para elaborar sus panes.  

La socia Alejandra agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 52 years old. She is a widow with three children. She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Her economic activity is the making of Oropesa bread. (Oropesa bread is part of the history and culture of this area. Made from local flour, generally it has a bit of sugar, egg, perhaps some cinnamon or anise or other spice, and can contain raisins at fiesta time.) She has been in this business for some years and it is going very well.

Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur that was invited to participate in the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” from the Asociación Arariwa. At this time Alejandra is asking for a loan in order to buy more supplies such as bags of flour, bags of sugar, butter and other items.

The borrower’s dream is to have her own oven as currently she rents a site in order to make her bread.

Alejandra appreciates the loan and she promises to comply with the fees according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as bags of flour, bags of sugar, butter and other items.

loans.name: Merry Mhae

texts.en:
Merry Mhae is a 24-year-old resident of Tukuran. Merry Mhae helps her family with the small amount of 6,000 she gains monthly from her own piggery business, which she has had for a year. 

In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC. She is asking for a loan from GDMPC of 10,000 to buy feeding supplies for the pigs. 

Merry Mhae wants to expand her business one day and to improve her family's living situation too.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her piggery.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Sarah operates a fish vending business for a living, while her husband does fishing. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. In 2008, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun, 37, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Dambae district, Cambodia. All of her children – two sons and two daughters – are dependent and now they are still in school. To feed the family, Phoeun and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice and cassava for several years. They earn about 14,500 riels (KHR) per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

This is Phoeun’s group loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund and her group has only two members who have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She and her group member completely paid back their past loans with VisionFund. Phoeun has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Phoeun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her family’s business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her family’s farm

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un joven de 23 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, tiene playas hermosas y también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son muy alegres y son muy conocidos por su gran don en la preparación de platillos ya que cocinan riquísimo. En su tiempo libre le gusta mucho estudiar ya que el se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma, en ocasione también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca.

Con mucho esfuerzo Alfredo inicio su negocio de cabinas de internet, impresiones, escaneos y tipeos desde hace ya 2 años, anteriormente trabajaba en varios oficios pero poco a poco fue ahorrando y logro tener el negocio, Alfredo trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y comparte su trabajo con sus estudios, ya que con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de los mismos; el cree que le va bien en su negocio por su esfuerzo y por las ganas que tiene de salir adelante y por la amabilidad en la atención de los clientes.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de estudio como libros, separatas, separatas, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para poder estudiar  y poder seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y que su negocio sea muy grande”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a young man 23 years old. He lives in the city of Chincha, a city that is characterized by a warm and inviting climate. It has beautiful beaches and also it is the birthplace of great and glorious Peruvian sports. The people too are happy and are known for their great gift for preparing and cooking delicious dishes. In his free time he likes to study and he is studying Agricultural Engineering. Occasionally he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious Carapulcra with dry soup. (Stew of pork and dehydrated potatoes, with peanuts and local spices.)

Alfredo put a lot of effort into starting his business of Internet booths, printing, scanning and typing 2 years ago. Formerly he worked in various jobs but little by little he was saving and he was able to have the business.

Alfredo works in the business about 8 hours a day and shares his work with his studies because his work can pay the expenses. He believes that his business is going well because of his efforts and the desire to get ahead and for his kindness and attention to his customers.

Alfredo is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to the support they have provided he could buy study materials such as books, reprints and other items. In this way he can have the necessary supplies in order to study and be able to continue fighting in search of his biggest dream: to finish his studies and to have a very large business.

loans.use: to buy study materials

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINAN est composé de vingt sept personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Agnès n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agnès est mariée à un certain Salomon. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent à leur charge. Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Agnès transforme et vend depuis dix ans, des noix de palme et de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) dans une école du Bénin. Agnès s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WANGNINAN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Wangninan group is composed of 27 persons who are friends belonging to the same community savings group. This is the third time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand its business. The group’s representative, by the name of Agnès, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Agnès is 44 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. Her husband’s name is Salomon. They have five children, all in school, and three still in their care. Agnès lives together with her husband and children and jointly with her husband supports the household. In order to provide for various family needs, for 10 years Agnès has been processing and selling palm nuts as well as cooked dishes (rice with sauce) at a school in Benin. She stocks up in her region and in a town of Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Agnès, together with the other members of the Wangninan group, is seeking her third lon from ALIDé. This loan will surely allow them to expand their business and earn a bigger profit. The two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts,  rice and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals for men and women in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica  de la socia es la elaboración de pan  de “oropesa”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más.  

La señora Yolanda agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 44 years old, married, and from this relationship she has 4 children. She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Her economic activity is the making of Oropesa bread. (Oropesa bread is part of the history and culture of this area. Made from local flour, generally it has a bit of sugar, egg, perhaps some cinnamon or anise or other spice, and can contain raisins at fiesta time.) She has been doing this for some years and her business is going well.

Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur that was invited to participate in the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” of the Asociación Arariwa. At this time, Yolanda is requesting a loan in order to buy more supplies such as bags of flour, bags of sugar, butter and other items.

Yolanda is grateful for the loan and she agrees to complete the payment of the fees according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as bags of flour, bags of sugar, butter and other items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica  de la socia es la elaboración de pan  de “oropesa”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Luzmila es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Luzmila requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más.  

La socia Luzmila agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luzmila is 55 years old, is married and has four children from her marriage.  She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her economic activity is the making of "Oropesa" bread.  She has been working in this field for several years and it is going well.  

Luzmila is a motivated and hard-working woman who was invited to participate in the Communal Bank "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" or "Our Lady of the Assumption of Oropesa" of the Arariwa Association.  At this time she needs a loan in order to purchase more food products, such as sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, butter, and assorted other items.  

Luzmila is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the loan fees on time in accordance with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, butter, and assorted other items.

loans.name: Cuatro Bocas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Cuatro Bocas” se formó con la unión de 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familias que se esfuerzan por dar a sus hijos lo mejor.
Maria es miembro del grupo, ella cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser patos, gallinas, cerdos y demás. Cuenta que le va bien porque tiene mucha paciencia con los animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir dando buenos alimentos a sus crías. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas reciben.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cuatro Bocas" is made up of 11 women from the city of Santani.  All of these women are heads of households, and they work hard to provide the best for their children.

Maria is a member of this group.  She says that she works raising and selling barnyard animals such as ducks, hens, pigs and others.  She says that her activity is going well because she has a lot of patience with her animals.  

She is requesting a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  This way, she can continue to provide good food to the animals that she is raising.  She is grateful for the help that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: 1º De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 1ro. De Noviembre  fue formado por 15 señoras emprendedoras, las mismas son mujeres humildes y trabajadoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
María Zunilda, la presidenta, se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de segunda mano, cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que todo su esfuerzo lo hace para dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The  "1º de Noviembre" communal bank was formed by 15 enterprising ladies. They are modest and hard-working women who seek a better future for themselves and their families.

María Zunilda, the chairperson, sells second-hand clothing as a street vendor. She says that her work involves a great deal of sacrifice, but that all of the effort she makes is to give her family everything that they need.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy second-hand clothing, with which she will be able to continue selling, and helping her family.

loans.use: To buy articles of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Sebastián” es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos, y demás.
Son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante ya que tienen muchas ganas y un gran espíritu emprendedor.
Blanca, la presidenta, solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales, como ser balanceados, raíces y demás.
texts.en: The communal bank San Sebastian is from the city of Santani. It is made up of 12 women, all of them friends and neighbors from that city. All of them work breeding and selling farm animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks, and others. They are hardworking woman that struggle to get ahead and they have big desires and a great entrepreneurial spirt. Blanca, the president, is asking for a loan in order to buy food for her animals, such as animal feed, roots and more.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and roots

loans.name: Oriental Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oriental” tiene 10 miembros, donde una de ellas es la señora Adelina, donde ella es la presidenta de este grupo trabajador y emprendedor.
Adelina nos dice que siempre trata de motivar y ayudar a sus compañeras a que sigan esforzándose y luchando. Ella tiene una despensa bien ubicada, donde ya tiene muchos clientes gracias a su buen precio y amabilidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, carnes y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Oriental" has 10 members, one of whom is Adelina.  She is the president of this hardworking and enterprising group.  

Adelina tells us that she always tries to motivate and help her fellow group members, so that they continue to strive and fight for progress.  She has a well-located store where she already has a lot of customers, thanks to her good prices and friendly service.

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, dairy products, meats and other items.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, meats and other products

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Luzviminda is married and has 8 children. To make a living, she sells snack food items in the market. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Luzviminda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,400 PHP which will be used to buy more food items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nueva Esperanza es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas las miembros son amigas y vecinas y tratan siempre de ayudarse y superar sus obstáculos.
Adalis, la presidenta, vende todo tipo de prendas, como ser jeans, remeras, camperas, abrigos y demás. Es gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que con ello podrá seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Nueva Esperanza is the group formed in the city of Caacupé, where all of the members are friends and neighbors and they try always to help each other and overcome obstacles. Adalis, the president, sells all types of clothing such as jeans, t-shirts, jackets, coats and more. Thanks to her effort and work she is getting ahead and helping her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy winter clothing, as she could continue having a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del  comité, una de las miembros invito a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surge el grupo que se llama”San Juan“están en el Décimo Quinto Ciclo con 21  integrantes.
Teodosia es miembro del grupo, ella es peluquera y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que hace muy buenos trabajos. Empezó con muy poco, pero gracias al trabajo que hace está saliendo adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, gel, tintes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
To form the communal bank, one of the members invited her friends and neighbors, and that is how the group called "San Juan" came about. They are in their 15th loan cycle, with 21 members.

Teodosia is a member of the group. She is a hairdresser and says that she has a very good clientele, as she does very good work. She began with very little, but is succeeding thanks to the work she does.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as shampoo, rinses, gel, hair coloring, and other items, so that she can continue working and giving her customers good service

loans.use: To buy shampoo, rinses, gel, hair coloring and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married to Jane, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been selling cereals for the past six years. His monthly income is 10,500 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family. 

John is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy sacks of dry maize, beans and wheat flour. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build a store for storing his cereals and to improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dry maize, beans and wheat.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is forty-four years old and single with three children. She runs a beddings business, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 for the last five years. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of bed sheets, bed covers, and nets for sale. 

With the anticipated profits she will invest back into her business. Her future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bed sheets, bed covers, and nets

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 30, is married with three dependent children who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Kang Meas district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice, selling sugarcane juice, and selling fish in her village. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about US $7 per day and she is able to save about US $2 each day. Earning a living as a farmer has enabled Chanthy to encounter low crop yields, which has affected her family’s income. 

Chanthy received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, support her family’s needs, and save some money from the earnings for the future. With a good business, she is applying for another loan of US $1,000 so as to buy a cow to raise as labor in rice farming. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise as labor in rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
Don José tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos  y vive en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Él tiene un pulperia, Hace 4 años la estableció y es ayudado por su esposa, La puso con el motivo de tener un trabajo propio y de mejorar su nivel de vida.  En su pulpería vende productos básicos como golosinas, lácteos, granos básicos, pan y entre otros productos. La pulpería está ubicada en un lugar céntrico con buen movimiento, lo cual ha aumentado el rendimiento de las ventas.
El señor José ha solicitado su primer préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como ser granos, lácteos, golosinas y así mejorar sus ingresos  y aumentar su inventario con la compra. 
Espera surtir más la pulperia y poder educar bien a sus hijos.  En el futuro quiere establecer otra pulpería en otra zona céntrica.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, is in a civil union, and has three children. He lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula. 

He has had a small grocery store for four years and his helped out by his wife. He started the store to have his own business and improve his quality of life. He sells basic products such as sweets, dairy products, basic grains, and bread, among other things, at his store. The store is located in a central area with a lot of traffic, which has increased his sales profits. 

José has requested his first loan of 15,000 lempiras with ODEF to invest in the purchase of food products like grains, dairy products, and sweets. That way he can improve his income and increase his inventory with the purchase. He hopes to stock his store more and be able to give a good education to his children. In the future he wants to start another small grocery store in another central location.

loans.use: to buy food products such as grains, dairy products, and sweets to stock his small grocery store.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Nak is aged 46 and married. He has five children, only three of whom are dependent on the family and are now still in school. Living in a village of the Krokor district, Nak buys and sells pigs while his wife raises the pigs. Now her family is raising four pigs in the backyard. Having been in the pig business for 25 years, he manages to earn about 96,000KHR per day to feed his family and children. 

This is the fourth loan for Nak with VisionFund. He completely repaid the past three loans, which has enabled his family to buy a plot of farmland, buy more pigs to raise, and keep his children in school. With this loan, he is going to use it to buy more piglets for his family’s business and use a portion of it to spend for house building. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a new house for living in and increase his pig business to gain more income and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for his family’s business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is single and a mother of 1 child. She is 59 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamis City. Esmeralda operates a tractor, which is used in land plowing, to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. She earns PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase more tractors used in the business. Esmeralda been member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tractors used in the business

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 33, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Dambae district. She has two daughters to take care of and they are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for several years and the current business earns her family about 23,000KHR per day. 

There are two members in Sophal’s group and they are both first-cycle clients with VisionFund. Sophal, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better and keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Madelyn has been buying and selling gasoline per liter in her local community. Aside from that she also has a sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase gasoline to resell.

Madelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to resell

loans.name: Kimyoy's Group

texts.en:
Kimyoy is aged 56 and married with seven children. Her family lives in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and she and her husband earn a living by farming rice and planting cassava. 

Kimyoy is an existing client of VisionFund who has received the loans for two cycles. The past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow more crops and sell it for a good price to make a better living. In the future, she wants to plant rubber trees and live happily in a big house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years old, married, and a mother of three children aged seven, four, and two years. She sells charcoal, a business she started 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 37,000. 

She has requested her first loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her in buying additional stock for her business and also paying the school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to see her business expand in order to create job opportunities to the youth in her society. She also hopes to help the needy.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Margarita Yessill

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula en el departamento de Cortes junto a su hijo de 5 años de edad y su madre. 
Margarita vende tamales y sopas en los fines de semana.  Ella ofrece una gran variedad de comida incluyendo tamales de pollo, cerdo  y de res, y otras comidas como sopas de pollo, res, caracol y marinera por encargo y vende refrescos y  jugos naturales de nance, tamarindo, mora, y otros sabores. 

Ella después de haber estudiado en una universidad pública de la región, Margarita no pudo encontrar trabajo. Pensando en su hijo, ella optó por vender comida para estar estable en su casa y dar más atención a su hijo. 

Ya tiene dos años trabajando en lo propio y ella nota que un desafío para su negocio es cuando los precios de insumos suben, porque ella tiene que aumentar el valor de su producto. 

El año pasado solicito un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual compro una olla de cocina para hacer las sopas y ha visto un gran cambio en su negocio, a la fecha le ha ido muy bien pago el préstamo sin problemas y ahorro un poco para seguir invirtiendo. 

Ahora  está solicitando un segundo crédito de L13,000  para complementar la compra de  equipo nuevo como utensilios de cocina para elaboración de comidas, ya que le ofrecen un local como cafetería donde va establecer mejor el negocio y vender los días de semana también. 
Su plan por el momento es incrementar las ventas y los ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Margarita is 22 years old and is a single mother. She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula in the Cortes department together with her five-year-old child and her mother. Margarita sells tamales and soups on the weekends. She offers a great variety of meals including chicken, pork, and beef tamales as well as other foods like chicken, beef, conch, and seafood soups by the order. She also sells sodas and natural juices like nance [a small, sweet, yellow fruit], tamarind, blackberry, and other flavors. After studying at the regional public university, Margarita could not find work. In thinking about her child, she decided to sells food to have a stable household and be able to give more attention to her child. Now she had been doing this for two years. She mentions that one challenge in her business happens when the price of supplies rises because she has to increase the price of her products. Last year she requested a loan of 10,000 Lempiras, which she used to purchase a kitchen pot to make her soups. She has seen a big change in her business and up to now it has gone very well for her. She paid off her loan without any problems and saved some to continue investing. Now she is requesting this second loan for 13,000 Lempiras to complete the purchase of new implements like kitchen utensils to make her meals as she has been offered a cafeteria storefront where she will be able to better establish the business and make sales during the week. Her plan for the moment is to increase sales and the family income.

loans.use: to buy new implements like kitchen utensils to make meals.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Flordeluna has been buying and selling copras and bananas to her community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase copras and bananas to resell.

Flordeluna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy copras and bananas to resell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 27 years old. She is married to Paul and together they have one child. She operates a cereals shop whereby she sells assorted cereals like dry maize, beans, green grams, and dry peas. She has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to us by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cereals for reselling in her business.

She hopes to start selling cereals through wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cereals for reselling

loans.name: Don De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DON DE DIEU est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Marthe est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayaba Marthe est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayaba Marthe n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Marthe est mariée à un certain Célestin. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Ayaba Marthe vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Ayaba Marthe vend des produits vivriers, des liqueurs, du charbon de bois et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Ayaba Marthe s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayaba Marthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DON DE DIEU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group DON DE DIEU (gift from God) consists of fifteen members who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

The group’s representative is Ayaba Marthe, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Ayaba Marthe, age 41, lives in Benin. She never attended school. She is married to a man named Célestin. The couple have five dependent children, four of them being their own. Ayaba Marthe lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Ayaba Marthe sells food products, liqueurs, charcoal and cosmetic products from her home. She buys her stock locally and in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Ayaba Marthe and the other members of the group DON DE DIEU are seeking a first loan from ALIDé. This loan will help them to bolster their activity and boost their profits.

loans.use: to buy food products, liqueurs and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Gloribel

texts.es: Gloribel, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace dos años y medio, vende productos de consumo diario como arroz, frijoles, jabón, detergentes, manteca, azúcar, churros, etc. y también elabora y vende nacatamales(son hechos de harina de maíz rellenos con arroz, carne, papas, aceitunas, alcaparras y otros, envuelto con hojas de banano).los nacatamales los vende de acuerdo a pedidos de los clientes. Ella esta agradecida con ODEF y ahora a Kiva por el apoyo financiero para su negocio y bienestar familiar. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero que es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en compra de productos de consumo diario para surtir su pulpería y una parte la utilizara para acondicionar el lugar donde cocina los tamales, comprara 2 canaletas y 5 láminas para techar.  Ya acondicionado el local va contratar personal que le ayude al crecimiento del negocio, espera incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio, su familia y crecimiento personal.
texts.en:
Gloribel is 29 years old and is a single mother. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of the San Pedro Sula municipality, Cortes. 

She has had her own business for two and a half years. She sells daily consumption products like rice, beans, soap, detergents, lard, sugar, churros, etc. She also makes and sells nacatamales (made from corn meal and stuffed with rice, meat, potatoes, olives, capers, and other ingredients, and wrapped in banana leaves). She sells the nacatamales as ordered by customers. 

She is grateful to ODEF, and now Kiva, for the financial support of her business and her family's well being. This is the third loan she has requested. It is for 21,000 Lempiras and she will invest it in the purchase of daily consumption products to stock her store. A portion of the loan will be used to improve the storefront where she makes her tamales. She will buy two gutters and five sheets for the roof. Once the place is improved, she will hire people to help her grow the business. She hopes to increase her sales and her income. Her goal is to grow the business, and help her and her family grow.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her small grocery store business and improve the storefront where she makes food for sale (nacatamales).

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina  de 46 años, desde hace 6 se dedica a la actividad comercial y genera ingresos con los que logra apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su hijo de 12 años. Cuando comenzó lo hizo con productos elaborados en plata, distribuyéndolos a crédito entre vecinos y referidos por estos; Así fue como poco a poco generó ingresos y fue tomando nuevos pedidos de otros artículos como colonia, cosméticos y últimamente trabaja con vitaminas y productos naturales, que le envía un familiar del extranjero. Su principal mercado son las amas de casa, empleados de empresas y su primera clientela doméstica de vecinos, con la cual continua. Las ventas las realiza mensualmente mediante pedidos que recoge de su preventa, ella también compra artículos en la vecina ciudad de Barranquilla y en la plaza del mercado de la ciudad de Cartagena, en la modalidad de contado. En la actualidad ha recibido 2 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado aumentar notablemente su capital de trabajo y de sus utilidades, así mismo a nivel personal ha logrado mayor autonomía y vencer temores con respecto a la venta de los productos que ofrece y por eso da gracias a Dios. Su meta es comprar productos en mayor cantidad, para obtener mejores precios y trasladarlos al beneficio de su clientela, de la cual recibe las utilidades al rotar cada vez más sus mercancías. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local en su propia casa, con la que aun no cuenta. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento al que está aplicando en la Fundación y con esta inversión planea comprar una vitrina y surtirla de platería y colonias norteamericanas con las que sus compradores se encuentran muy compenetrados.  Luz Marina una vez tenga su nueva virina surtida, impactará la visión   una vez mas, de  su mercado y muy seguramente sus utilidades habrán de duplicarse y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de credikiva.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 46 years old. She has been working commercially for 6 years and generating income to help support the household, which consists of her husband and her 12 year old son.

She began with products made from silver, distributing them on credit among neighbors and referrals. And so little by little she generated profit and she was taking new orders for other articles such as cologne, cosmetics and recently working with vitamins and natural products, that a relative sends her from abroad. Her customers are mainly housewives, company employees and the domestic help of her neighbors, which is ongoing. Sales take place by monthly preorders she collects. She also buys articles in the nearby city of Barranquilla and in the Cartagena market square, paying by cash.
